name: Red Velvet Cake with Beets
author: sopenia
summary: After reading about the history of the popular red velvet cake, I wanted to try the version with beets. It has a beautiful color and tastes divine with or without frosting. This recipe makes one sheet cake, a 2-layer cake, cupcakes, or even cake pops.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a 9x13-inch cake pan with parchment paper
Sift flour and baking powder together in a large bowl
Whisk sugar, buttermilk, beets, oil, eggs, cocoa powder, red food coloring, vanilla extract, vinegar, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl
Add flour mixture gradually to the bowl, stirring after each addition just until incorporated
Tap pan firmly to settle the batter and remove large bubbles
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 35 minutes
